input.description: XML document conforming to the Connection Details Concept that contains the information required to execute a command via command line.
Specifies the globally unique identifier (GUID) of the partition containing the operating system from which the boot entry is being copied.
Specifies the globally unique identifier (GUID) of the partition containing the operating system from which the boot entry is being copied.

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation Succeed? Valid value: true.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Windows Server 2008"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">c:\windows\SysNative\bootcfg /clone /upddrv /sg ${sguid} /tg ${tguid}</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows XP"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">c:\windows\SysNative\bootcfg /clone /upddrv /sg ${sguid} /tg ${tguid}</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows 2003"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">c:\windows\SysNative\bootcfg /clone /upddrv /sg ${sguid} /tg ${tguid}</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">echo Command not supported by Windows 2000</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Cisco IOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">show</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/bin/echo "Not Supported."</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">/usr/bin/echo "Not Supported."</xsl:text> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description:
On Itanium-based computers, creates a copy of an Extensible Firmware Interface (EFI) boot entry for use in a mirrored boot volume.
Update Driver: Updates the device path to the EFI drivers.
